item.description: â—ï¸âš ï¸ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ª Trump has designated Venezuela's current government as a foreign terrorist organization, alleging that the nation has "stolen American assets," such as oil and land. He has implemented a complete blockade on sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela, insisting that these assets must be returned to the U.S. without delay. In response, Maduro has alleged that the U.S. intends to use anti-drug cartel operations as a cover for regime change and the appropriation of resources.

item.description: âš ï¸ According to a source from RIA Novosti, EU representatives are set to conclude talks today in a morning meeting regarding the use of Russian assets for Kyiv. Hungarian Prime Minister Orban has emphasized that Hungary will not back the confiscation of frozen Russian assets under any circumstances. EU leaders may reach a consensus on the language for asset confiscation during the summit on December 18, while leaving technical details for further examination by the EU Council and European Parliament, as reported by Politico. item.description: ğŸ”¥ T-Investments has successfully tokenized 14 artworks by contemporary artist Rostan Tavassiev, with Sistema Gallery acting as the issuer. The investment term is set for one year, maturing in December 2026. Investors can expect a promising 30% yield if the painting is sold, and an assured 8% yield if it is not. item.title: âš ï¸ In his recent remarks regarding Venezuela, former President Trump characterized the situation as ...
item.description: âš ï¸ In his recent remarks regarding Venezuela, former President Trump characterized the situation as a blockade and accused the country of unlawfully confiscating American assets. He pointed out Venezuela's ousting of U.S. companies, along with the associated loss of land and oil extraction rights. Trump reaffirmed the U.S. commitment to reclaiming what was lost, underscoring a message of national strength. For additional details, visit MT in MAX.

item.title: ğŸ“° In a national address, former President Trump chose not to discuss Venezuela or Ukraine, instead h...
item.description: ğŸ“° In a national address, former President Trump chose not to discuss Venezuela or Ukraine, instead highlighting the achievements of his administration. He claimed that in just 11 months, they accomplished more than any prior administration while tackling inherited challenges. Trump emphasized that the US border is now the most secure it has ever been, reported a decline in migrant outflows, and noted a 94% decrease in maritime drug trafficking. He also mentioned plans for 1,600 power plants and the strength of the military. Additionally, he pointed out that the next Federal Reserve Chair is in favor of lowering interest rates. MT in MAX

item.title: âš ï¸ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ª The U.S. House of Representatives has turned down two resolutions put forward by Democrats that...
item.description: âš ï¸ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡ª The U.S. House of Representatives has turned down two resolutions put forward by Democrats that aimed to stop strikes on vessels in the Caribbean and military actions directed at Venezuela. The first resolution aimed to limit Trump's military initiatives in the Western Hemisphere without Congressional approval. The second called for an end to U.S. military operations related to Venezuela unless Congress authorized them. Trump has previously indicated that he would not dismiss the possibility of air, sea, and ground operations against Venezuela. Find out more on MT in MAX

item.title: ğŸ“° The United States has expressed its opposition to the European Union's decision to seize Russian a...
item.description: ğŸ“° The United States has expressed its opposition to the European Union's decision to seize Russian assets, cautioning that this action could lead to the EU and the UK needing to return those funds to Russia. Washington is concerned that such measures might prolong the conflict in Ukraine and diminish Western influence over Moscow. According to Politico, the U.S. is pressuring the EU to refrain from utilizing Russian assets for Ukraine. Additionally, The Washington Post reports that the U.S. plans to allocate $100 billion of frozen Russian assets to aid Ukraineâ€™s recovery, with the remainder set aside for a Russian-American investment fund aimed at promoting peace. MT in MAX

item.title: ğŸ“° According to The Times, the United States is against the European Union's plans to seize Russian a...
item.description: ğŸ“° According to The Times, the United States is against the European Union's plans to seize Russian assets, cautioning that such measures might eventually force the EU and UK to return the funds. There are worries that this could extend the Ukraine conflict and diminish Western influence over Moscow. Politico reports that the U.S. is urging the EU to refrain from utilizing Russian assets for Ukraine. Additionally, the Washington Post has uncovered a U.S. proposal to allocate frozen assets for post-conflict arrangements, with a commitment of $100 billion towards Ukraine's reconstruction. For more information, visit MT in MAX.

item.title: ğŸ—ï¸ Venezuelan President Maduro addressed rising tensions with the US, asserting that Venezuela will ...
item.description: ğŸ—ï¸ Venezuelan President Maduro addressed rising tensions with the US, asserting that Venezuela will not be subjected to colonial rule. He called on Colombia's military to join forces with Venezuela against the US. Maduro further accused Washington of trying to install a puppet government in Caracas. Meanwhile, reports suggest that the USS Gerald Ford has approached Venezuela, signaling a potential countdown to military action. Colombian President Petro cautioned that any US attacks on Colombian targets would constitute a declaration of war.

item.description: âœ´ï¸ Binance CEO CZ revealed that he is focusing his efforts on four main initiatives: Giggle Academy, YZi Labs, the BNB ecosystem, and advancing global cryptocurrency adoption. item.title: ğŸ”— EU member states were unable to come to a consensus on seizing Russian assets during the initial d...
item.description: ğŸ”— EU member states were unable to come to a consensus on seizing Russian assets during the initial day of discussions, primarily due to Belgium's requests. Negotiations will carry on. The EU summit has directed the Commission to develop a "reparation credit" for Kyiv utilizing Russian assets. In addition, the EU has agreed to extend a â‚¬90 billion interest-free loan to Ukraine for the years 2026-2027. Hungary, Czechia, and Slovakia have chosen to withdraw from the funding initiative. Ursula von der Leyen proposed that a qualified majority vote could potentially allow for the unfreezing of sovereign Russian assets.

item.title: ğŸ”¥ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Japan's central bank has raised interest rates to a 30-year peak of 0.75%, as anticipated, marki...
item.description: ğŸ”¥ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Japan's central bank has raised interest rates to a 30-year peak of 0.75%, as anticipated, marking the first increase since January 2025. The yield on 10-year Japanese bonds has reached 2%, the highest level since 2006, amid ongoing inflation that exceeds targets. The bank indicates a potential for gradual further rate increases.
